data.title: Naked Lunch by Burroughs, First Edition, olympia
data.meta_description: The Naked Lunch [The Traveller's Companion series] by William Burroughs and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Used - Good. 1959. First Edition. No. 76 in the Olypia Press 'Traveller's Companion' series. A fairly good copy of the first issue of this imprtamt book (has the 'Francs: 1.500' price on rear wrapper and the green border on title page, as required). Lacks the pictorial dj. Wraps scuffed and worn, especially at extremities, with a piece missing from rear lower corner. A dark borwn stain (probably coffee?) extends throuh the upper right corner of the text-block, across part of the front cover, and a bit of the back cover. Though well-used, still a moderately good copy of a book which is scarce in any condition.

First Edition, first impression, in Great Britain. Publisher's beige paper-covered boards with gilt lettering to spine. Clear, removable, archival protective cover fitted to the illustrated dust-jacket, lettered in red and black. Octavo. pp. [4], 252. Originally published in English by Olympia Press in 1959, and subsequently by Grove Press, New York in 1962, Sugar Editore, Milan, 1963 and Editions Gallimard, Paris in 1964. A book in Near Fine condition with a slight lean and odd speckle to top edge, in a Very Good dust-jacket with one tiny nick to rear top edge, slight edge creasing and a little rubbing, but which is not price-clipped (showing '42s'). 'The Naked Lunch is a book of beauty, great difficulty and maniacally exquisite insight' - Norman Mailer. Naked Lunch is considered Burroughs' seminal work, and one of the landmark publications in the history of American literature. Extremely controversial in both its subject matter and its use of obscene language (something Burroughs recognised and intended), the book was banned in Boston and Los Angeles in the United States,and several European publishers were harassed. It was one of the more recent American books over which an obscenity trial was held. The book was banned in Boston in 1962 due to obscenity (notably child murder and acts of pedophilia), making it among the last works to be banned in that city, but that decision was reversed in 1966 by the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court. The Appeals Court found the book did not violate obscenity statutes, as it was found to have some social value. The hearing included testimony in support of the work by Allen Ginsberg and Norman Mailer.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First Edition, first impression, in Great Britain. Publisher's beige paper-covered boards with gilt lettering to spine. Octavo. pp. [4], 252. Originally published in English by Olympia Press in 1959, and subsequently by Grove Press, New York in 1962, Sugar Editore, Milan, 1963 and Editions Gallimard, Paris in 1964. Book and Dust-jacket in very good condition, no annotations. 'The Naked Lunch is a book of beauty, great difficulty and maniacally exquisite insight' - Norman Mailer. Naked Lunch is considered Burroughs' seminal work, and one of the landmark publications in the history of American literature. Extremely controversial in both its subject matter and its use of obscene language (something Burroughs recognised and intended), the book was banned in Boston and Los Angeles in the United States,and several European publishers were harassed. It was one of the more recent American books over which an obscenity trial was held. The book was banned in Boston in 1962 due to obscenity (notably child murder and acts of pedophilia), making it among the last works to be banned in that city, but that decision was reversed in 1966 by the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court. The Appeals Court found the book did not violate obscenity statutes, as it was found to have some social value. The hearing included testimony in support of the work by Allen Ginsberg and Norman Mailer.

Softcover. Condition: Wie neu. Dust Jacket Condition: Neu. 1. Auflage. First Edition, Fist Printing with the "Francs : 1.500" un-cancelled price printed on the back. A near fine copy, with faint tanning to the spine, but otherwise tight and clean. We have added a $25 facsimile dust jacket, however, the very first copies (to which this belongs) were issued without one: "Miles states that the very first issues were released without the dust jackets; they were added after a month or so." (Maynard & Miles, p. 10). This item part of our catalogue 5: 100 Key Books, which you can view at ygrbooks.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: none. First edition. Pocket paperbound book. 226 pp. The first printing, first issue of the beat classic novel by Burroughs. First issue points apply with original Francs 1,500 on the rear cover. This copy in good to very good condition with general light handling wear. Binding is square and covers are clean. Lacks the original illustrated dustwrapper. A solid example overall of what has become, along with On The Road and Howl, part of the classic beat triangle of books most sought after by collectors.

Paperback. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. First Edition 12mo with 226 pages. A paperback original of this infamous novel. First Edition 12mo with 226 pages. Points including green border on title page and "18" Label covering we believe the Francs : 1,500 on back cover of the book. You can see an NO and under that a TH Under the 18 label which is: NOT TO BE SOLD IN THE U.S.A. OR U.K. The book is in good condition with some foxing to top edge and slight foxing on long edge. The dust jacket has tear to top of spine that measures 3/4" by 1/2." A collectible copy. #020372 Size: 12mo. Paperback.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. "The Naked Lunch" by William Burroughs. Olympia Press, Paris. 1959 first edition, with 1500 francs on DJ and NF 18 stamped on back cover. Book in very good condition, name to ffep, minor wear to edges, in original dustwrapper in original cover, with some paper loss to rear. Naked Lunch (sometimes The Naked Lunch) is a 1959 novel by American writer William S. Burroughs. The book is structured as a series of loosely connected vignettes, intended by Burroughs to be read in any order.[1] The reader follows the narration of junkie William Lee, who takes on various aliases, from the U.S. to Mexico, eventually to Tangier and the dreamlike Interzone. The vignettes (which Burroughs called "routines") are drawn from Burroughs' own experiences in these places and his addiction to drugs: heroin, morphine and, while in Tangier, majoun (a strong hashish confection), as well as a German opioid with the brand name Eukodol (oxycodone), of which he wrote frequently.[2] The novel was included in Time 's "100 Best English-language Novels from 1923 to 2005".[3] In 1991, David Cronenberg wrote and directed a film of the same name based on the novel and other Burroughs writings.

First edition but second issue. Softcover. 225 pages. A paperback original. Burrough's classic book which was the basis for an David Cronenberg directed movie with Peter Weller, Judy Davis, Ian Holms, Roy Scheider and Julian Sands. Second state with the new price on the rear panel. A very good plus copy in green wrappers with some slight soiling to the page edges, some slight splitting along the rear internal hinge and the price increase stamp to the rear panel and in a very good plus dust jacket with some minor wear and a small chip to the top of the rear panel. Despite the flaws, a very presentable copy.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First Issue. Very Good in a Very Good jacket, unclipped (Francs 1500), toned and rubbed at the surface and edges, chipped at the top-left corner of the front panel and the head of the spine. Green wraps, rubbed at the edges with a bump at the bottom-left corners, priced at Francs: 1500 on the back. Bound with a bit of reading wear, a few spots of toning at the edges, clean internally. The classic cut-up experimental novel from one of America's most profound writers of the 20th century. Adapted into the 1991 movie by David Cronenberg.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. A very good copy in the rare original dust jacket designed by Burroughs. With green decorative border round title page. One of 5000 copies printed thus. One of the big three novels of the Beat Generation. First edition with 1500 francs on DJ and NF 18 stamped on back cover. Condition: Dj in removable plastic film. A couple of chips to edges, wear along front edge of spine where the glossy coating is delaminating slightly. 1 inch tear at bottom of dj spine along rear fold. Darkening to spine. Front card cover offset from text block 1/8 inch / 2mm. pp17-32 pulling away from spine but holding. Pages clean and bright. Size: 7 x 4.5 inches / 18 x 11 cm. 226 pages. Weight: 210g.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: very good. First edition. Pocket paperbound book in Burroughs' illustrated dustwrapper. 226 pp. The first printing, second issue of the beat classic novel by Burroughs. Second issue points apply with new price NF 18 francs on rear cover. This copy in very good condition with a small area of light staining to the bottom of the front endpaper spilling over slightly on to the inside front cover. Binding is square and covers are clean. The thick illustrated dustwrapper (designed by Burroughs himself) is also in very good condition with light soiling and wear. A solid example overall of what has become, along with On The Road and Howl, part of the classic beat triangle of books most sought after by collectors.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Largely written in Tangiers, where Burroughs lived for several years before moving to Paris, The Naked Lunch has strong themes of drug addiction and homosexuality. Loose pages of manuscript had to be rescued by his friends, typed up and placed in some semblance of order before Maurice Girodias, the legendary Parisian owner of the Olympia Press, could be persuaded to publish it as a fitting addition to his successful line of books; books that were viewed by most simply as pornography. While much early pornography seems tame by today's standards The Naked Lunch still has the power to shock. I am offering a copy of the true first printing (with the price shown as Francs 1,500) but with a faded spine and some staining to edges and prelims.

Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First edition. A Very Good copy in like dust jacket. Rear free end paper of the book excised and some splitting at the lower inside joint. Dust jacket with some overall age toning and a small chip at the base of the spine. First printing with the green border on the title page and the original publisher's price of 1500 Francs on both the rear cover of the book and the rear flap. No price defacement, stickers or stamps as is usually found on later states of the book and jacket. William S. Burroughs' infamous novel meanders through the absurd and perverse in an improbable, non-linear narrative. While the adventure jumps from fictional dictatorships, to Mexico, to space, much of the book remains inspired by Burroughs' own drug addiction and his friendships with Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg, core Beat Generation members. Upon its publication in 1959, "The Naked Lunch" was banned from numerous cities though its literary significance was later recognized by Time magazine and the book was included in their Top 100 English speaking novels from 1923 to 2005. Very Good in Very Good dust jacket.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Paris, The Olympia Press, 1955. First Edition. First Impression. Paperback. A very good copy. 1500 Francs to rear flap. A provocative and groundbreaking work that explores the dark underbelly of addiction and society. A cornerstone of the 20th-century counterculture. A little tearing to the top of the spine and light wear to corners and lower tip. A little tanning to the spine. Creasing to the spine. [10911, Hyraxia Books].
